intro: Bauhinia erythrantha, commonly known as the red-flowered bauhinia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate leaves that are often divided into small, pointed leaflets. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, adding ornamental value to gardens. Bauhinia erythrantha thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. It is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
